caption.p: Effects of the inhaled Origanum majorana essential oil (1%OmEO (III) and 3%OmEO (IV)) on the spontaneous alternation percentage ( A) and locomotor activity ( B) in the Y-maze test and on the working memory errors ( C) and reference memory errors ( D) during seven-day training in the radial arm-maze test in the Aβ1-42-treated rats. Values are means ± S.E.M. ( n = 7 animals per group). Statistical significance was determined by one-way ANOVA. For Tukey’s post hoc analyses: A. Sham (I) vs. Aβ1-42 (II): ** p = 0.0048 and Aβ1-42 (II) vs. Aβ1-42 + 1%OmEO (III): ## p = 0.0018; C. Sham (I) vs. Aβ1-42 (II): **** p < 0.0001; Aβ1-42 (II) vs. Aβ1-42 + 1%OmEO (III): #### p < 0.0001 and Aβ1-42 (II) vs. Aβ1-42 + 3%OmEO (IV): #### p < 0.0001; D. Sham (I) vs. Aβ1-42 (II): **** p < 0.0001 and Aβ1-42 (II) vs. Aβ1-42 + 1%OmEO (III): # p = 0.0142.
